Description: Body and rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of North Ionian black-figured pottery plate; slipped cream; exterior: band at join of rim and wall; three thicker bands at top of wall and frieze of long rays and small dot rosettes below; verticals on outside of rim, stopt maeander on top; at outside of floor lotus flower and bud chain, with incised details; to the centre, meander and slight remains of an animal frieze; friezes separated by bands with superimposed added red bands lined in white.
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VII, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.759)
